heroParagraph: Bologna as a living lab to understand what makes a climate shelter effective, how it intersects with urban fragility, and how TALEA can guide planning decisions.
heroTagline: From generic green space to climate shelters: data, maps and stories for the SUOA.
heroCard1Small: public green areas included in the CSI model
heroCard3Small: normalised climatic fragility per statistical area
csiSectionTitle: Where climate shelters are and how they perform
csiSectionSubtitle: Not every park is a climate shelter: here we look at quality (CSI), amenities and accessibility of Bologna's green spaces.
csiHint: Tip: use the filters to focus on parks with the highest capacity to offer relief (high / very high CSI).
csiHistTitle: Distribution of the Climate Shelter Index (CSI)
csiHistHint: How many parks actually have a high CSI? The histogram shows how many green areas fall into each quality class.
amenitiesHint: Fountains, benches and tables are core elements of a climate shelter: here you can see in how many parks they are present.
cfiSectionTitle: Climatic and social fragility by district
cfiSectionSubtitle: The most fragile areas combine heat exposure, poor access to climate shelters and socio-economic vulnerability. Here we see how these factors converge in urban space.
cfiHint: Hover statistical areas to read CFI (climatic fragility), overall F and HF. The map highlights high-priority zones.
cfiVsCsiHint: Each dot is a statistical area: top-left you find places with high climatic fragility and low shelter quality — natural candidates for TALEA interventions.
fragilityClassHint: The class distribution shows how climatic fragility pushes districts towards higher levels of overall risk.
